cardiology: Chest pain and shortness of breath
Swelling in legs or ankles (possible heart failure)
dermatology: Unusual skin mole or lesion changes
gastroenterology: Blood in stool or black-colored stool
orthopedics: Joint pain or stiffness (e.g., in the knees or shoulders)
Difficulty walking due to back or leg pain
Swollen or fractured limbs from injury
pediatrics: Fever and irritability in infants or toddlers
Delayed growth or abnormal weight gain
psychiatry: Persistent sadness or loss of interest in daily activities
oncology: Lumps or masses that can be felt through the skin
ophthalmology: Eye pain or redness with sensitivity to light
Sudden loss of vision or flashing lights
pulmonology: Shortness of breath during daily activities
Coughing up blood or mucus with unusual color
